metadata.synopsis: Player approaches Cazador who is preparing for the Black Mass Ritual.Cazador is suprised.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Ctrl+Shift+7 (Origin Debug Book)Astarion - Origin Moments - Act 3 Black Mass RitualApproach Cazador to start the dialog WITHOUT Astarion

44.speaker: Cazador Szarr
44.text: I believed all our guests had been dealt with upstairs. Werewolves leave so much to be desired.

26.speaker: Cazador Szarr
26.text: But as you are here, it would be a shame to waste the audience.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Cazador, I presume? What is going on here?

85.speaker: Cazador Szarr
85.text: You came here wholly ignorant? With no concept of what you were about to witness?

71.speaker: Cazador Szarr
71.text: This is the Rite of Profane Ascension - attempted only once in legend.

74.speaker: Cazador Szarr
74.text: Seven thousand souls, each bearing the scar of the one who brought them to me, stand ready to be sacrificed.

65.speaker: Cazador Szarr
65.text: In their blood I shall be reborn, free to walk in the sun's rays. Free from sanguinary hunger. And free to crush any who stand against me with merciless power.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I know all about your ritual. I won't let you go through with it.

0.speaker: Cazador Szarr
0.text: Ha! You are a worm, lecturing the crow about to consume you.

46.speaker: Cazador Szarr
46.text: You will not stop this ritual. Nothing will stop this ritual.

59.speaker: Cazador Szarr
59.text: No, your timing is perfect. All is in place.

1.speaker: Cazador Szarr
1.text: Wait - no. It cannot be. Were you the one who took my poor Astarion under your wing, only to abandon him so cruelly?

87.speaker: Cazador Szarr
87.text: Please, I care not for your petty drama. In truth, you made all of this possible.

35.speaker: Cazador Szarr
35.text: Now that he is mine once more, I have everything I need. This ritual - this Black Mass that has been centuries in the making - is finally ready.

41.speaker: Cazador Szarr
41.text: Witness the birth of the Vampire Ascendant! Ecce dominus!

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Taken by mind flayers, then monster hunters, then you. That's a run of bad luck.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: In my defence, he was being a dick.

6.speaker: Cazador Szarr
6.text: Truly? I could have sworn I knew you. Perhaps it is your plain, forgettable face.

81.speaker: Cazador Szarr
81.text: But it matters not. You are here now, just as we consummate our most profane rite.

69.speaker: Cazador Szarr
69.text: Now this is unexpected. You who follow on the heels of our poor, lost son.

23.speaker: Cazador Szarr
23.text: Has he sent you here to parley on his behalf? Will he not even speak to his own family?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: He's not coming - and you can't complete this ritual without him.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: What do you want from him?

56.speaker: Cazador Szarr
56.text: You came here wholly ignorant? With no concept of what you were about to witness?

39.speaker: Cazador Szarr
39.text: This is the Rite of Profane Ascension - attempted only once in legend.

20.speaker: Cazador Szarr
20.text: Seven thousand souls, each bearing the scar of the one that brought them to me, stand ready to be sacrificed.

34.speaker: Cazador Szarr
34.text: In their blood I shall be reborn, free to walk in the sun's rays. Free from sanguinary hunger. And free to crush any that stand against me with merciless power.

31.speaker: Cazador Szarr
31.text: Blessed are you to be the first I shall consume when I become the Vampire Ascendant.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: He's not coming. You'll never see him again.

11.speaker: Cazador Szarr
11.text: And you are certain he will not come to me?

51.speaker: Cazador Szarr
51.text: You presume to know the boy better than I? I who made him?

62.speaker: Cazador Szarr
62.text: Tell me, then - what is he feeling? Right this moment, in whatever rathole he is cloistered?

54.speaker: Player
54.text: He's worried about me and wants me to get back safe.

76.speaker: Cazador Szarr
76.text: Ha! Oh, you sweet idiot. No.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: He's fine. He's safe from you.

66.speaker: Cazador Szarr
66.text: Hardly. Even he knows better than that. Nowhere is safe.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: He trusts me to end this.

17.speaker: Cazador Szarr
17.text: Trust? Astarion? One of his few redeeming features is that he never trusts anybody.

13.speaker: Cazador Szarr
13.text: No, he is afraid. He is afraid because all he has ever known is you and me, and without us he is nothing.

2.speaker: Cazador Szarr
2.text: When you do not return from this place, he will want to flee. He will want to leave this city and all its horrors behind. But he won't.

49.speaker: Cazador Szarr
49.text: He will come here, because he knows nothing else. Because he is incapable of anything else.

19.speaker: Cazador Szarr
19.text: Perhaps he convinces himself he can save you, perhaps he slinks back like a beaten dog. It does not matter, either way he will return. Either way he will be mine.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I won't let you use me as bait.

25.speaker: Cazador Szarr
25.text: Please, did Astarion tell you nothing about me?

18.speaker: Cazador Szarr
18.text: I am the immortal Cazador Szarr. And I always get what I want.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: What if I just bring Astarion to you? I could walk him right in here.

84.speaker: Cazador Szarr
84.text: You would turn on him? How delightfully treacherous. Hmm...

32.speaker: Cazador Szarr
32.text: You would turn on him? How delightfully treacherous. Hmm...

37.speaker: Cazador Szarr
37.text: Very well, I give you one chance. Return with my wayward boy, and perhaps I will let you live.

28.speaker: Cazador Szarr
28.text: But cross me and, I promise, I will deliver you an eternity of suffering.

45.speaker: Cazador Szarr
45.text: I hope we understand each other. Now, go.

38.text: I wish I could believe you, I truly do. But alas, I have been cursed with inordinate intelligence and am not about to give up this bird in the hand.

60.speaker: Cazador Szarr
60.text: I wish I could believe you, I truly do. But alas, I have been cursed with inordinate intelligence and am not about to give up this bird in the hand.

7.speaker: Cazador Szarr
7.text: No, you will stay here. You will be mine, now and forever!

5.speaker: Cazador Szarr
5.text: You think you can stand against me?

3.speaker: Cazador Szarr
3.text: I am the immortal Cazador Szarr! And you will be mine.

47.speaker: Cazador Szarr
47.text: How... succinctly put. Indeed, he is terrified.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: And you call yourself his family? You're a monster.

58.speaker: Cazador Szarr
58.text: What is family, if not the monsters we are obliged to love?

43.speaker: Cazador Szarr
43.text: That is why he will come back to me. Because he yearns to be with his people. Because this is all he knows.

10.speaker: Cazador Szarr
10.text: Oh, you have been an interesting distraction for him, no doubt, but your time together is over.

64.speaker: Cazador Szarr
64.text: When you don't return, he will realise he has nowhere else to go. He will come to me. And he will be mine.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You're not his family - you're a monster.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'm here to discuss handing him over. I can save you a lot of trouble.

70.speaker: Cazador Szarr
70.text: A bold offer. And one I would be a fool to accept.

9.text: A bold offer. And one I would be a fool to accept.

77.speaker: Cazador Szarr
77.text: A bold offer. And one I would be a fool to accept.

8.speaker: Cazador Szarr
8.text: All I need do is ensure you never return to him, and that sweet idiot will soon come searching for you.

36.speaker: Cazador Szarr
36.text: No, you are not leaving. Not now, not ever.

83.speaker: Cazador Szarr
83.text: My instructions were clear - bring me back the boy or suffer.

68.speaker: Cazador Szarr
68.text: I see you chose the latter. Very well, then.
